title: Relics
description: An exploration-based datapack adding new structures and magical items found deep underground
body:
![Logo](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/778324851487801367/1117175979492773958/Base_Vector.png)

**Relics** is a little passion project that expands on Minecraft's sub-par adventuring aspect. It intends to add new diverse structures, making every journey unique and rewarding, providing new mechanics and collectables, and of course, dangers!

If you're interested in a taste of what the pack has to offer before playing yourself, check out the trailer, [here!](https://youtu.be/p0r7uICpKYw)

## Getting Started
**Relics** is meant to be something you can discover on your own. You will easily find all of its content on your own without requiring a wiki or guide, especially with each item being explained ingame! Get out there and do some digging!

## Frequently Asked Questions
**"Does <x> work with Spigot/Paper/Purpur/etc..."**
If you're having trouble with it on one of those, probably not. I have not tested it and cannot fix it.

**"Is there a way to spawn in items?"**
/loot give @s loot <pack>:item/<item>

**"When will <x> update/release?"**
I don't know, please stop asking, it will only make me take longer.

**"I'm having resourcepack problems with another datapack!"**
If you're using multiple datapacks, merge them with Weld here:
https://weld.smithed.dev/ 

## About Centerpiece
**Centerpiece** is a Data Pack library pre-installed alongside all of my (SkittishSkivy) Data Packs. All installed Data Packs that run Centerpiece must use the same Centerpiece version. This Data Pack's current Centerpiece version is: **0.1**
